body: LEAD: THE serenity of Boerum Hill, a neighborhood lined with Greek Revival, Italianate and early Victorian brownstones, is quite a contrast to the bustle of downtown Brooklyn, just a five-minute walk away. body: LEAD: ''If I had my legs, I'd dance the Peabody,'' said Helen Barnes, 76 years old, a patient at the Cobble Hill Nursing Home in Brooklyn and a double amputee. body: LEAD: THE FOOD DAY BEGINS shortly before midnight at the Hunts Point Terminal Market in the Bronx. It is a militaristic-looking complex in a wasteland of auto wreckers and junkyards. body: LEAD: Every afternoon at 3 o'clock, a private patrol car begins rolling through one of the prettiest neighborhoods in Brooklyn. It cruises under canopies of ailanthus and maple trees, past unbroken rows of 19th-century brownstones, chocolate-rich and crisply preserved, with their jaunty window bays and welcoming stoops. body: LEAD: It is spring, and the five boroughs of New York City are bursting with things to do and to see that cost nothing, or next to nothing ($3 or less). Here is a highly selective list. title: THE REAL NEW YORK: THE WAYS WE USE THE CITY; The Best Things In Life . . .

body: LEAD: The man who was killed by a police officer Monday afternoon after he slashed at pedestrians with a 12-inch blade on a crowded East Side street had been arrested six months ago in Brooklyn for menacing people with a knife, the police said yesterday. title: Slain Knife-Wielder Had Troubled Past

body: LEAD: Brooklyn is getting its second condominium parking garage, this one in the Cobble Hill neighborhood. title: POSTINGS: What Price Parking?; A 2d Garage Condo
